latestVersion.termsOfUse: The research leading to these results was carried out as part of the project LOCALMULTIDEM (Multicultural Democracy and Immigrantsâ Social Capital in Europe: Participation, Organisational Networks, and Public Policies at the Local Level: http://www.um.es/localmultidem). The project received funding from the European Commission's Sixth Framework Programme under grant agreement number CIT5-CT-2005-028802. Additionally, the data for Stockholm was collected with funding from the Bank of Sweden Tercentenary Foundation and the Swedish Council for Working Life and Social Research; and the data for Oslo was collected with funding from the Research Council of Norway. All users of the datasets must agree to add the following acknowledgement of funding and production in any publication using these datasets:  "Results presented in this paper/article/book/thesis stem from integrated datasets produced by the project âMulticultural Democracy and Immigrantsâ Social Capital in Europe: Participation, Organisational Networks, and Public Policies at the Local Level (LOCALMULTIDEM)â. This project was funded by the European Commission under the 6th Framework Programmeâs Priority 7 âCitizens and Governance in a Knowledge-Based Societyâ as a STREP instrument (contract no. CIT5-CT-2005-028802). The LOCALMULTIDEM consortium was coordinated by the University of Murcia (Dr Laura Morales), and was formed by the University of Geneva (Dr Marco Giugni), the University of Trento (Prof Mario Diani), the University of Bristol (Prof Paul Statham), the CEVIPOF â Sciences Po Paris (Dr Manlio Cinalli), the MTAKI (Dr Endre Sik) , and the University of Manchester (Dr Laura Morales). The data for Stockholm were collected by a team that included Prof Bo Bengtsson, Dr Gunnar Myrberg and Dr Per StrÃ¶mblad with funding from the Bank of Sweden Tercentenary Foundation and the Swedish Council for Working Life and Social Research. The data for Oslo were collected by a team that included Jon Rogstad with funding from the Research Council of Norway."  To be informed about the project and possible updates to the data, we encourage you to subscribe to our newsletter: https://listas.um.es/sympa/info/localmultidem_newsletter

fields.value: LOCALMULTIDEM and MDE Institutional Political Opportunity Structures Indicators (WP1) Dataset, 2006

dsDescriptionValue.value: This study contains the data collected through Workpackage 1 relating to Institutional Political Opportunity Structures of the Localmultidem project and through other related sister projects that formed part of the Multicultural Democracy in Europe (MDE) research network. It also contains the documentation (guidelinse, list of variables, codebook, etc.) required to understand and analyze the data. This workpackage involved collecting information at the contextual (or macro) level through the use of secondary sources and interviews with political and administrative authorities. It contains data for 9 cities: Barcelona, Budapest, Geneva, London, Lyon, Madrid, Milan, Stockholm and Zurich.

publicationCitation.value: Morales, Laura, and Marco G. Giugni, eds. Social Capital, Political Participation and Migration in Europe. Making Multicultural Democracy Work? Basingstoke: Palgrave, 2011.

value: Barcelona, Budapest, Geneva, London, Lyon, Madrid, Milan, Oslo, Stockholm, Zurich

files.description: This deliverable contains the city reports for Workpackage1.  Description and discussion of the institutional opportunity structures for the political integration of immigrants at the local level in the main six cities of the study (Budapest, London (North, 4 boroughs), Lyon, Madrid, Milan and Zurich)

dataFile.description: Document including all items that were used to measure Institutional POS as well as the instructions that were followed in order to code each indicator and additional description and info on the released data for workpackage 1 of the Localmultidem project.

files.description: The aggregate dataset of WP1 of Localmultidem (excel format): detailed scores (sheet1) and summary scores (sheet2) for all the indicators of institutional POS in Budapest, London, Lyon, Madrid, Milan, Zurich, Geneva, Stockholm and Barcelona (and for selected urban areas within the cities of Lyon and London). For all cities, POS indicators are measured and apply to 2006 (WP1).
files.label: WP1_InstPOSDatasheet _Public.xls

dataFile.description: The aggregate dataset of WP1 of Localmultidem (excel format): detailed scores (sheet1) and summary scores (sheet2) for all the indicators of institutional POS in Budapest, London, Lyon, Madrid, Milan, Zurich, Geneva, Stockholm and Barcelona (and for selected urban areas within the cities of Lyon and London). For all cities, POS indicators are measured and apply to 2006 (WP1).
